                    260
                    
                    
                      
#' Prepare Results as Data Frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    261
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    262
                    
                    
                      
#' Function takes the results from [eval_capture_conditions()], which is a

                    		
                  

                  

                    263
                    
                    
                      
#' named list, e.g. `list(result=, warning=, error=)`, and converts it to a data

                    		
                  

                  

                    264
                    
                    
                      
#' frame.

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (named `list`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    
                    
                      
#'   the result from [eval_capture_conditions()]

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    
                    
                      
#' @param variable (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    
                    
                      
#'   variable name of the results

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    
                    
                      
#' @param fun_name (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    
                    
                      
#'   name of function called to get results in `x`

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    
                    
                      
#' msgs <- eval_capture_conditions({

                    		
                  

                  

                    278
                    
                    
                      
#'   warning("Warning 1")

                    		
                  

                  

                    279
                    
                    
                      
#'   warning("Warning 2")

                    		
                  

                  

                    280
                    
                    
                      
#'   letters[1:2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    
                    
                      
#' })

                    		
                  

                  

                    282
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    283
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.lst_results_as_df(msgs, "result", "mean")

                    		
                  

                  

                    284
                    
                    
                      
.lst_results_as_df <- function(x, variable, fun_name) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    285
                    
                    
                      
  # unnesting results if needed

                    		
                  

                  

                    286
                    1132x
                    
                      
  if (.is_named_list(x$result, allow_df = TRUE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    287
                    !
                    
                      
    if (is.data.frame(x$result)) x$result <- unclass(x$result)

                    		
                  

                  

                    288
                    24x
                    
                      
    df_ard <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    289
                    24x
                    
                      
      dplyr::tibble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    290
                    24x
                    
                      
        stat_name = names(x$result),

                    		
                  

                  

                    291
                    24x
                    
                      
        result = unname(x$result),

                    		
                  

                  

                    292
                    24x
                    
                      
        warning = list(x$warning),

                    		
                  

                  

                    293
                    24x
                    
                      
        error = list(x$error)

                    		
                  

                  

                    294
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    295
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    296
                    
                    
                      
  # if result is not a nested list, return a single row tibble

                    		
                  

                  

                    297
                    
                    
                      
  else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    298
                    1108x
                    
                      
    df_ard <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    299
                    1108x
                    
                      
      map(x, list) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    300
                    1108x
                    
                      
      dplyr::as_tibble() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    301
                    1108x
                    
                      
      dplyr::mutate(stat_name = .env$fun_name)

                    		
                  

                  

                    302
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    303
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    304
                    1132x
                    
                      
  df_ard |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    305
                    1132x
                    
                      
    dplyr::mutate(variable = .env$variable) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    306
                    1132x
                    
                      
    dplyr::rename(stat = "result")

                    		
                  

                  

                    307
                    
                    
                      
}

#' Convert Nested Lists to Column

                    		
                  

                  

                    311
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    312
                    
                    
                      
#' Some arguments, such as `stat_label`, are passed as nested lists. This

                    		
                  

                  

                    313
                    
                    
                      
#' function properly unnests these lists and adds them to the results data frame.

                    		
                  

                  

                    314
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    315
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    316
                    
                    
                      
#'   result data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    317
                    
                    
                      
#' @param arg (`list`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    318
                    
                    
                      
#'   the nested list

                    		
                  

                  

                    319
                    
                    
                      
#' @param new_column (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    320
                    
                    
                      
#'   new column name

                    		
                  

                  

                    321
                    
                    
                      
#' @param unlist (`logical`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    322
                    
                    
                      
#'   whether to fully unlist final results

                    		
                  

                  

                    323
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    324
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a data frame

                    		
                  

                  

                    325
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    326
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    327
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    328
                    
                    
                      
#' ard <- ard_categorical(ADSL, by = "ARM", variables = "AGEGR1")

                    		
                  

                  

                    329
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    330
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.process_nested_list_as_df(ard, NULL, "new_col")

                    		
                  

                  

                    331
                    
                    
                      
.process_nested_list_as_df <- function(x, arg, new_column, unlist = FALSE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    332
                    
                    
                      
  # add fmt_fn column if not already present

                    		
                  

                  

                    333
                    334x
                    
                      
  if (!new_column %in% names(x)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    334
                    334x
                    
                      
    x[[new_column]] <- list(NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    335
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    336
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    337
                    
                    
                      
  # process argument if not NULL, and update new column

                    		
                  

                  

                    338
                    334x
                    
                      
  if (!is_empty(arg)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    339
                    171x
                    
                      
    df_argument <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    340
                    171x
                    
                      
      imap(

                    		
                  

                  

                    341
                    171x
                    
                      
        arg,

                    		
                  

                  

                    342
                    171x
                    
                      
        function(enlst_arg, variable) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    343
                    198x
                    
                      
          lst_stat_names <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    344
                    198x
                    
                      
            x[c("variable", "stat_name")] |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    345
                    198x
                    
                      
            dplyr::filter(.data$variable %in% .env$variable) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    346
                    198x
                    
                      
            unique() %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    347
                    198x
                    
                      
            {stats::setNames(as.list(.[["stat_name"]]), .[["stat_name"]])} # styler: off

                    		
                  

                  

                    348
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    349
                    198x
                    
                      
          compute_formula_selector(

                    		
                  

                  

                    350
                    198x
                    
                      
            data = lst_stat_names,

                    		
                  

                  

                    351
                    198x
                    
                      
            x = enlst_arg

                    		
                  

                  

                    352
                    
                    
                      
          ) %>%

                    		
                  

                  

                    353
                    
                    
                      
            # styler: off

                    		
                  

                  

                    354
                    198x
                    
                      
            {dplyr::tibble(

                    		
                  

                  

                    355
                    198x
                    
                      
                variable = variable,

                    		
                  

                  

                    356
                    198x
                    
                      
                stat_name = names(.),

                    		
                  

                  

                    357
                    198x
                    
                      
                "{new_column}" := unname(.)

                    		
                  

                  

                    358
                    
                    
                      
            )}

                    		
                  

                  

                    359
                    
                    
                      
          # styler: on

                    		
                  

                  

                    360
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    361
                    
                    
                      
      ) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    362
                    171x
                    
                      
      dplyr::bind_rows()

                    		
                  

                  

                    363
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    364
                    171x
                    
                      
    x <- x |> dplyr::rows_update(df_argument, by = c("variable", "stat_name"), unmatched = "ignore")

                    		
                  

                  

                    365
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    366
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    367
                    334x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(unlist)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    368
                    167x
                    
                      
    x[[new_column]] <- lapply(x[[new_column]], function(x) x %||% NA) |> unlist()

                    		
                  

                  

                    369
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    370
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    371
                    334x
                    
                      
  x

                    		
                  

                  

                    372
                    
                    
                      
}

#' Add Default Formatting Functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    375
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    376
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

.default_fmt_fn <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    388
                    167x
                    
                      
  x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    389
                    167x
                    
                      
    dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    390
                    167x
                    
                      
      fmt_fn =

                    		
                  

                  

                    391
                    167x
                    
                      
        pmap(

                    		
                  

                  

                    392
                    167x
                    
                      
          list(.data$stat_name, .data$stat, .data$fmt_fn),

                    		
                  

                  

                    393
                    167x
                    
                      
          function(stat_name, stat, fmt_fn) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    394
                    25689x
                    
                      
            if (!is_empty(fmt_fn)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    395
                    21x
                    
                      
              return(fmt_fn)

                    		
                  

                  

                    396
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    397
                    25668x
                    
                      
            if (stat_name %in% c("p", "p_miss", "p_nonmiss")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    398
                    5131x
                    
                      
              return(label_cards(digits = 1, scale = 100))

                    		
                  

                  

                    399
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    400
                    20537x
                    
                      
            if (is.integer(stat)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    401
                    19557x
                    
                      
              return(0L)

                    		
                  

                  

                    402
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    403
                    980x
                    
                      
            if (is.numeric(stat)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    404
                    962x
                    
                      
              return(1L)

                    		
                  

                  

                    405
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    406
                    18x
                    
                      
            return(as.character)

                    		
                  

                  

                    407
                    
                    
                      
          }

                    		
                  

                  

                    408
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    409
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    410
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' ARD-flavor of unique()

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Essentially a wrapper for `unique(x) |> sort()` with `NA` levels removed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' For factors, all levels are returned even if they are unobserved.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' Similarly, logical vectors always return `c(TRUE, FALSE)`, even if

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' both levels are not observed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`any`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   a vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.unique_and_sorted(factor(letters[c(5, 5:1)], levels = letters))

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.unique_and_sorted(c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.unique_and_sorted(c(5, 5:1))

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
.unique_and_sorted <- function(x, useNA = c("no", "always")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
  # styler: off

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    375x
                    
                      
  useNA <- match.arg(useNA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
  # if a factor return a factor that includes the same levels (including unobserved levels)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    375x
                    
                      
  if (inherits(x, "factor")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    4x
                    
                      
    return(

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    4x
                    
                      
      factor(

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    4x
                    
                      
        if (useNA == "no") levels(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    4x
                    
                      
        else c(levels(x), NA_character_),

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    4x
                    
                      
        levels = levels(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
      )

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    371x
                    
                      
  if (inherits(x, "logical")) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    10x
                    
                      
    if (useNA == "no") return(c(TRUE, FALSE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
    else return(c(TRUE, FALSE, NA))

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
  # otherwise, return a simple unique and sort of the vector

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    264x
                    
                      
  if (useNA == "no") return(unique(x) |> sort())

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    95x
                    
                      
  else return(unique(x) |> sort() |> c(NA))

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
  # styler: on

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' Named List Predicate

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' A predicate function to check whether input is a named list and _not_ a data frame.

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`any`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'   object to check

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a logical

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.is_named_list(list(a = 1:3))

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
.is_named_list <- function(x, allow_df = FALSE) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2217x
                    
                      
  if (isFALSE(allow_df)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    1085x
                    
                      
    return(is.list(x) && is_named(x) && !is.data.frame(x))

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    1132x
                    
                      
  if (isTRUE(allow_df)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    1132x
                    
                      
    return(is.list(x) && is_named(x))

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#' A list_flatten()-like Function

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#' Function operates similarly to `purrr::list_flatten(x, name_spec = "{inner}")`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (named `list`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#'   a named list

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#' @return a named list

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
#' x <- list(a = 1, b = list(b1 = 2, b2 = 3), c = list(c1 = 4, c2 = list(c2a = 5)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#' cards:::.purrr_list_flatten(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
.purrr_list_flatten <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    509x
                    
                      
  ret <- list()

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    509x
                    
                      
  for (i in seq_along(x)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    343x
                    
                      
    if (.is_named_list(x[[i]])) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    342x
                    
                      
      ret <- append(ret, values = x[[i]])

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    1x
                    
                      
      ret <- append(ret, values = x[i])

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    509x
                    
                      
  ret

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Standard Order of ARD

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' ARD functions for relocating columns and rows to the standard order.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' - `tidy_ard_column_order()` relocates columns of the ARD to the standard order.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' - `tidy_ard_row_order()` orders rows of ARD according to variables, groups, and

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   strata, while retaining the order of the input ARD.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' @name tidy_ard_order

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' # order columns

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' ard <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   dplyr::bind_rows(

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#'     ard_continuous(mtcars, variables = "mpg"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'     ard_continuous(mtcars, variables = "mpg", by = "cyl")

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'   )

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#' tidy_ard_column_order(ard) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#'   tidy_ard_row_order()

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname tidy_ard_order

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
tidy_ard_column_order <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    351x
                    
                      
  group_cols <- dplyr::select(x, all_ard_groups()) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    351x
                    
                      
    names() |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    351x
                    
                      
    sort()

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    351x
                    
                      
  dplyr::select(

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    351x
                    
                      
    x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    351x
                    
                      
    all_of(group_cols),

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    351x
                    
                      
    all_ard_variables(),

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    351x
                    
                      
    any_of(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    351x
                    
                      
      "context",

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    351x
                    
                      
      "stat_name", "stat_label", "stat", "stat_fmt", "fmt_fn",

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    351x
                    
                      
      "warning", "error"

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
    )),

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    351x
                    
                      
    dplyr::everything()

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @rdname tidy_ard_order

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
tidy_ard_row_order <- function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    22x
                    
                      
  check_class(x, cls = "card")

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
  # get columns that dictate ordering

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    22x
                    
                      
  cols <- x |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    22x
                    
                      
    dplyr::select(

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    22x
                    
                      
      all_ard_variables("names"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    22x
                    
                      
      all_ard_groups("names"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    22x
                    
                      
      all_ard_groups("levels")

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
    ) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    22x
                    
                      
    names()

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
  # perform the ordering

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    22x
                    
                      
  x |> dplyr::arrange(across(all_of(cols), .fns = function(x) match(x, unique(x))))

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Print

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Print method for objects of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#'   object of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n (`integer`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#'   integer specifying the number of rows to print

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @param columns (`string`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'   string indicating whether to print a selected number of columns or all.

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @param n_col (`integer`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'   some columns are removed when there are more than a threshold of

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   columns present. This argument sets that threshold. Default is `6L`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @param ... ([`dynamic-dots`][dyn-dots])\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'   not used

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @return an ARD data frame of class 'card' (invisibly)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' ard_categorical(ADSL, variables = AGEGR1) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'   print()

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
print.card <- function(x, n = NULL, columns = c("auto", "all"), n_col = 6L, ...) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
  # convert to a data frame so the list columns print the values in the list ---

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    2x
                    
                      
  x_print <- as.data.frame(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
  # number of rows to print (modeled after tibbles print) ----------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    2x
                    
                      
  n <- n %||% ifelse(nrow(x_print) > 20L, 10L, nrow(x_print))

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    2x
                    
                      
  x_print <- utils::head(x_print, n = n)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
  # remove columns -------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
  if (arg_match(columns) %in% "auto") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
    # remove warning and error columns if nothing to report

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    2x
                    
                      
    if ("error" %in% names(x_print) && every(x_print[["error"]], is.null)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
      x_print[["error"]] <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    2x
                    
                      
    if ("warning" %in% names(x_print) && every(x_print[["warning"]], is.null)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    2x
                    
                      
      x_print[["warning"]] <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (ncol(x_print) > n_col) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    1x
                    
                      
      x_print[["fmt_fn"]] <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
    } # remove this col if there are many cols

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (ncol(x_print) > n_col) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    1x
                    
                      
      x_print[["context"]] <- NULL

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
    } # remove this col if there are many cols

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
  # truncate the 'group##_level', 'variable_level', 'stat_label', and 'context' columns ------

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
  x_print <-

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    2x
                    
                      
    tryCatch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
      x_print |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
        dplyr::mutate(

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    2x
                    
                      
          across(

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    2x
                    
                      
            c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
              all_ard_groups("levels"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
              all_ard_variables("levels"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
              any_of(c("context", "stat_label", "warning", "error"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
            ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    2x
                    
                      
            function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    4x
                    
                      
              lapply(

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    4x
                    
                      
                x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    4x
                    
                      
                function(e) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    26x
                    
                      
                  e <- as.character(e) |> paste(collapse = ", ")

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    26x
                    
                      
                  ifelse(nchar(e) > 9, paste0(substr(e, 1, 8), "\u2026"), e)

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
                }

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
              )

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
            }

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
          )

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
        ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    2x
                    
                      
      error = function(e) x_print

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
  # for the statistics, round to 3 decimal places ------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    2x
                    
                      
  if ("stat" %in% names(x_print)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    2x
                    
                      
    x_print$stat <- lapply(

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    2x
                    
                      
      x_print$stat,

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    2x
                    
                      
      function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    13x
                    
                      
        if (isTRUE(is.numeric(x))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    11x
                    
                      
          res <- round5(x, digits = 3)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
        } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    2x
                    
                      
          res <- as.character(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    13x
                    
                      
        if (is_string(res) && nchar(res) > 9) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    2x
                    
                      
          res <- paste0(substr(res, 1, 8), "\u2026")

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    13x
                    
                      
        res

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
  # for the formatting function column, abbreviate the print of proper functions

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    2x
                    
                      
  if ("fmt_fn" %in% names(x_print)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    1x
                    
                      
    x_print$fmt_fn <- lapply(

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    1x
                    
                      
      x_print$fmt_fn,

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    1x
                    
                      
      function(x) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    3x
                    
                      
        if (isTRUE(is.function(x))) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    2x
                    
                      
          return("<fn>")

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
        }

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    1x
                    
                      
        x

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
  # final printing --------------------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    2x
                    
                      
  cli::cli_text(cli::col_grey("{{cards}} data frame: {nrow(x)} x {ncol(x)}"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    2x
                    
                      
  print(x_print)

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    2x
                    
                      
  if (nrow(x) > n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    1x
                    
                      
    cli::cli_alert_info(cli::col_grey("{nrow(x) - n} more rows"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    1x
                    
                      
    cli::cli_alert_info(cli::col_grey("Use {.code print(n = ...)} to see more rows"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    2x
                    
                      
  if (ncol(x) > ncol(x_print)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    2x
                    
                      
    missing_cols <- names(x) |> setdiff(names(x_print))

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    2x
                    
                      
    cli::cli_alert_info(cli::col_grey(

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    2x
                    
                      
      "{length(missing_cols)} more variable{?s}: {paste(missing_cols, collapse = ', ')}"

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
    ))

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    2x
                    
                      
  invisible(x)

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Print ARD Condition Messages

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' Function parses the errors and warnings observed while calculating the

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' statistics requested in the ARD and prints them to the console as messages.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @param x (`data.frame`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'   an ARD data frame of class 'card'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @param call (`environment`)\cr

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'   frame for error messaging. Default is `NULL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @return returns invisible if check is successful, throws all condition messages if not.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @examples

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' ard_continuous(

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'   ADSL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#'   by = ARM,

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'   variables = AGE

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' ) |>

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'   print_ard_conditions()

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
print_ard_conditions <- function(x, call = NULL) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    1x
                    
                      
  check_class(x, cls = "card")

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
  # print condition messages ---------------------------------------------------

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    1x
                    
                      
  .cli_condition_messaging(x, msg_type = "error", call = call)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    1x
